election_record.label: Massachusetts 1809 House of Representatives, Salisbury

sub_unit.name: Salisbury
sub_unit.note: "Salisbury has elected Col. Jona. Smith (fed.) by a maj. of 60 odd votes - they have heretofore sent a democrat." Merrimack Intelligencer (Haverhill, MA). May 13, 1809.

"From Salisbury, May 9. This town has taken one step towards returning its political reputation, for it has chosen a federal Representative, Col. Jonathan Smith, by a majority of 72 votes." The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). May 16, 1809.

election_record.reference: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). May 16, 1809.
